title: Do you think love can really change a person? - Quora

response.answer_text: Through college I dated a girl off and on. Sometimes we thought we loved each other. Way too often we fought and hurt each other. All the time we were just plain crazy. She left for college so we dated others. She came back and we hooked up again. We clashed and broke up so we dated others. We made up and got back together. Rinse and repeat for five years. We thought this was love. I think it was insanity. Frankly I look back and my entire college experience was a string of broken relationships and hearts. By the time I graduated I felt lonely, frustrated and figured this is love. Then I met a girl unlike the rest. She at first didn’t even know I existed. When she finally did she had no interest in a relationship. Tough starting place. But my wit, charm and handsomeness finally broke through. Ok, ok, really just my persistence and that she happened not to be dating anyone at the time. We dated a little, then I went away to grad school. Yet, somehow I didn’t care about dating anyone else and amazingly neither did she. I’d come home and it was bliss. I’d leave and she was all I could think about. I felt a love for her and from her that simply I’d never experienced before. Someone who I never wanted to be without and who seemed to feel the same. Recently we celebrated our 45th wedding anniversary with some friends at our home. After they left, we’d cleaned the dishes and I’d taken a load of empty wine bottles to the trash. Whew, did we drink all that? As I turned off the lights in the dining room I turned to her and said, “You know, after 45 years, I’m still glad you’re the one I brought home from the dance.” She smiled and said, “I’m glad you did too.” Real love changes everything. There is no greater gift.

Instead of giving a logical answer, I would like to narrate my own small example. So I believe everyone changes with time. Just think about it, the ‘you’ from 5 years ago won’t recognize the ‘you’ now. What love does is assign priorities to certain changes such that they are accelerated and hence we notice them. I was quite reserved and didn’t like to talk to many people. I hated the romantic stuff too. I prided myself on being extremely logical and rational. I was strict in terms of forgiving people for their mistakes Over the course of time I was learning to talk to people, understanding more of human nature etc… But these changes were so slow that even I didn’t realize them for very long. Then love enters my life. I become addicted to that person. I’m spending hours talking to her. Then I spent hours talking to my friends how great she was and how she made me happy. I could see my own desire to just talk and talk. This was an instance of inherent accelerated change. Then there was the fact that she asked me to dress a little more to the occasion (I suck at personal grooming). Good advice, so I followed it. This was an instance of forced accelerated change. The third type was passive accelerated change. More feelings, also increased my empathy in general. I became more forgiving and accepting. So yes, Love changes you, but then so does many things like passion, career, even hunger for that matter. (P.s - I have quoted only positive changes, but change happens in both direction….always)

It depends on the intensity and the enduring nature of what you call ‘love’. It certainly can change someone partly and temporarily. But, in order for it to change someone completely and permanently, ‘love’ has to be very strong and long lasting. Besides, just as medicine which depends on the individual body chemistry of the patient to have the desired result without any adverse side effects, it also depends on the nature of the predisposition and psychological make up of the individual person undergoing the emotions of love. If that person is of a very sensitive and compassionate nature, love can bring about changes that may become permanent and if not, it will not. P S - I happen to read one answer suggesting one must be willing to lose one’s happiness for the other in love. I do not agree. That may probably apply in the case of unconditional motherly love and maybe in some romantic stories of the popular Mills & Boon books. But, in real life, and in the case of adult love, the boy sacrificing his happiness for the girl and the girl in turn sacrificing her happiness for the boy can only end up in both being unhappy defeating the very purpose of being in love - to be happy. So, please beware of such Utopian and impractical ideas about love.

As we can say what love is , love is the most powerful thing in the whole world as it is not about physical strength or ability. it is mental condition .. and by the way when i said mental i didn't mean mad , it's just that i is something that messes up with our mind and  mind is the most powerful part of a person and the most deadliest also........... And love changing a person. I dnt know really but i know one that . and that's for sure, persons does not change . the change we observe in a person is not like that the person is changed....... it's just that the person is adapting to the situation he/she is in and the adaptation to the situation is the change we feel in him/her ......... But in reality they dnt change......... The mind is no easily changed and it cannot be.......... even if it can be it will take avery long time.. And love changing people.......... Hmmmmmmmmm ..... not soo possible ....until there is some loosers who change them self for their girlfriend or boyfriend .. it's nothing it is just temporary changee even if they changeee................... Ah i dnt know whether love can change , but in ma opinion people really dnt change yaar...... Hope u understand Lek ;)

1 Corinthians 13:1-8 1 Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, but have not love, I have become sounding brass or a clanging cymbal. 2 And though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all mysteries and all knowledge, and though I have all faith, so that I could remove mountains, but have not love, I am nothing. 3 And though I bestow all my goods to feed the poor, and though I give my body to be burned, but have not love, it profits me nothing. 4 Love suffers long and is kind; love does not envy; love does not parade itself, is not puffed up; 5 does not behave rudely, does not seek its own, is not provoked, thinks no evil; 6 does not rejoice in iniquity, but rejoices in the truth; 7 bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things. 8 Love never fails. But whether there are prophecies, they will fail; whether there are tongues, they will cease; whether there is knowledge, it will vanish away. 1 Corinthians 13:10-13 10 But when that which is perfect has come, then that which is in part will be done away. 11 When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child; but when I became a man, I put away childish things. 12 For now we see in a mirror, dimly, but then face to face. Now I know in part, but then I shall know just as I also am known. 13 And now abide faith, hope, love, these three; but the greatest of these is love.

Yes its powerful My parents made me believe that love is powerful enough to change a person. My mom was a person who never like talking. And more over he hated black colour while she was young. One of her cousin is black and if he touches her, my mom would go take bath each time as she hated black so much. Guess my dad is black in colour. But now no one would believe if my mom hated black coz she is so loving and attached to dad. there is not a single day mom has failed pamparing my dad. Similarly my dad was a narrow minded person but now he has changed a lot. Mom’s love changed him that now he is a very fair minded person.  Arent they lovely... On the contrary, a friend of mine i loved her in the sense i trusted her so much but now she now in focusing on her life and is out of contact. She changed me not to trust anyone anymore. my parents are an example for a positive change that true love can bring and mine was an example for a negative change. Therefore love is powerful that it brings a change but it depends in our hands to make it a positive or a negative one. Waiting for my positive change..... Wishing you the same. Yes, its powerful changed him that now he is a fair minded person. On the

People really never change but sometimes only love can change people. Love changes us. It can bring us to some very dark places in our life, but it can also lead us onto an even better path. When I’ve fallen in love, it’s always been this overwhelming feeling of bliss and freedom. The feeling of freedom is in the person I am and in my potential in life. I feel like I can do anything and like I want to work harder at my goals and dreams, not just for myself, but now for my significant other. Love is truly a battlefield which can significantly change one’s life, perceptions, attitudes and values. Bottom line is when love does change you, because it can and it will, choose the right path and realize that the good path is the right kind of love. Embrace it at full speed ahead and always remember who you are on the way there. Never let love define you, instead let it shine through you. And here is a fun line at last “Love is the seventh sense which destroys all other senses and makes people believe in nonsense.”

Hello and thank you for asking. YESSSSSSSSS!!!! It can and does and I have experienced this personally unfortunately in a negative way. Due to so many physical and emotional things happen when you fall in REAL love, it can really be a messy or beautiful thing. The factor that dictates that is, is the person really IN LOVE big diff between loving someone and being IN love the levels of sacrifice and dedication are diff. Is the person already broken, wounded from the past, codependent a narcissist and the individuals agenda for themself and their partner and their vision and want for the future of that relationship. People change because endorphins and seritonin are flooding their bodies and then sometimes red flags are ignored or what ever and then here comes pain and pain turns almost most into a diff person based on how they deal with pain and the level of that pain. Love can also make people better, when we finally find someone we love and come out of our own needs and wants it grows us

Love is powerful no doubt but it is overrated thing which we think that it can change our lives. This idea is an illusion, if love were the most powerful thing in the world, why is there so much suffering all over the world? Here are some truths: Conscious love reflects back and forth,Emotional love can be dangerous with temporarily insanity of jealousy,Physical love depends on type and polarity,Please show me where love has tempered the world into peace, the love of God has taken more lives than any political metaphor. The feeling of love is powerful because of the chemicals that are released into the brain. This is how evolution helps in the reproduction process. One harsh fact: You dont know how much you truly love someone until they’re gone. I am accepting that love might be a change for people But on the other hand it is harmful too. There are both side of a thing either it is love or hate. So keep it in positive way and do better with the property you have, if you have someone’s love keep it, nurture it, support it and keep it real otherwise it can change your life in negative way too. Thanks for a2a :)

Every important relationship changes people to an extent, even if the person doesn’t know it himself. The change, however can be positive or negative. If the idea of the relationship from the very beginning is to change a person and someone tries to force the change on that person, chances are high the change will not be the desired one. Rather, the person would get frustrated and less responsive over time. Noone likes to hear they are inadequate and needs to change. If, on the other hand, the person is encouraged and loved for everything that he or she is, the person may change positively, slowly. The word of caution here is that change in a person is very slow. And it would happen at his/her own time & rate, not the ones that the other person wants. If the other person waits for the change, chances are high, he/she would get frustrated and start forcing it on the other. That won’t be good for anyone concerned. One more thing here is, a person’s behaviour is not the same for every other person he comes across. It keeps changing according to the dynamics of the relationship he has with another. So trying to have that proper dynamics is a good idea. Best wishes! :)

I love filter coffee. I really do. The best part about living in the Southern part of India is that the coffee is excellent. The favourite part of my morning is the five minutes after I’ve reached an empty office, gotten myself a nice hot mug of straang filter kaapi, and put my earphones on. Kathy’s Song floats in the air, and for five minutes, the world acquires an additional dash of meaning. I read something like this,  I won’t presume to translate this, because I can’t, really. and Gulzar seems to gently peel off a different layer to this world that never existed before. For five minutes, anything is possible. I'm wittier, even charming - I might even write something that gives meaning to a few moments of someone's life someday, or produce some work that leaves a tiny bite mark on the world. For five minutes. Then, slowly, I return to room temperature, to a world full of Excel shortcuts I cannot gracefully pull off, one where Yuzvendra Chahal is a serious Test prospect in England, one where I have to do that pesky little thing - writing - instead of just becoming a writer. It’s a world of tedium and of cursors that blink ruthlessly at me, a world full of words like ‘tedium’, and with way too demanding a requirement for action and engagement instead of simple, relentless, endless, imaginative dreaming. Coffee doesn’t change me. Contrary to what I might think, it doesn’t make me a good writer. It makes me want to be one, but those are sadly two very different things. When the caffeine wears off, and it always does, what matters is how willing I am to work, at writing and at everything else, and that part is far less sexy than the magical part with the coffee mug in my hand. The changing, whether fortunately or unfortunately, is entirely up to me. It's a scenic bend in the road. It’s not the destination. It feels good. It’s not enough. Coffee is love.

In our effort to find that “someone”, there are always lessons to be learned. Sometimes we marry because we don’t know better and other times we know better yet still marry. There is a line that is fine and sometimes very sharp. Without a good foundation with regards to the Self…we need lessons to hone who we are. We must be able to understand ourselves first and then the other person. For instance, as a young man I always thought that having a girlfriend was necessary…that I would find one and that they would really like me. That didn’t happen. I dated and started to learn more about them then myself. I was a pleaser and after a while…pleasing did not work. After I got married, for I was in love with this woman but I also knew she did not love me but being a hopeful man…I thought she would learn to love me. Fast forward…I learned that when a person accepts being second best in any relationship…you remain second best. Time, energy, and experience taught what schools could not. I learned that I have the control of me and not someone else. I learned to be strong in ways that helped me, helped me understand, and helped me connect with someone who was good for me and I for them. So love..is about respect. Love is offering help because help is offered in return. Love is allowing the other person to be who they are…warts and all, for the reflection is you in them and them in you. Love is strongest when freedom is allowed, allowed from both together. So the answer is Yes…love can really change a person…but it is not the love of the other person..it is the love of Self. To grant unconditional love to help heal the hurts we obtain ourselves and to move forward into loving someone else. Love changes but is strong as well. Love of self is a foundation other can stand upon…with you…not “on” you. Thus my wife…is not mine to control, not mine to boss around or not have her own opinion. As the First Nations express it: “She is my “Walk-Beside”. And we walk beside each other willingly and wholly and that should read Holy. Just Sayin.

Love is the most beautiful, wonderful and amazing feeling in the world, but it’s also frustrating, and devastating and sad. Love can change a person a lot, usually it makes you stop doing bad stuff just because that person hates it, or it can make you do something you never thought you would do, or you can become something different because that person changed you. I saw on a TV show this guy, who didn’t respect anyone and he was annoying and everyone wanted him to go away, but he met this girl, nice girl, and he fell in love with her. A few episodes later, he left her without telling her. But then, when he came back, he was completely changed and he thanked her for being there when no one else was. He went from being this horrible human everyone hated, to being this nice person who everyone liked. Love is really strong.

Love makes me want with every inch of me - with exigency, with urgency - to be a better person. It makes me feel expansive, elastic, inclusive, unrestrained. It’s love that reminds me of my good fortune, my potential, my free will and my power. It reminds me to consider others rather than just myself. Love forces me to carefully regard the outlines of me and treat them with respect; to clearly identify all the places where I end and another person begins. I love you so much but we are most certainly not one. Love crystalizes my boundaries, and has always been the laser light force - the supernova - behind defining again and again exactly who I am. Love widens my interests, teaches me how to return to battle day after day to fight to build and never to destroy. Love makes me feel alive more than anything. It’s you. It’s me. It’s the whole entire world coming into sharper focus. Look. Look how beautiful it all looks when you are here with me.

First,disappointment and betrayal are unavoidable in life.Simple acts of loving kindness can transform us emotionally to a better person. Second, life becomes interesting. Selfishness is boring. When we seek the happiness, security, and well-being of another in creative love the world becomes full and engaging. Third, loving others gives us a reason to develop our gifts. Students learn more when they have to tutor younger peers, or when they learn in groups and are responsible for teaching one another. Fourth, we make deeper friendships. Our friends are no longer the people we just hang out with, but they are the ones with whom we find exhilarating common cause and commitment. Finally we have serious friends. Fifth, loving others is a source of hope because as active agents we use our strengths to make a difference in the life of another, and we can therefore have greater confidence in shaping the future. Sixth, loving others is a source of joy. Happiness is to joy as optimism is to hope. Seventh, loving others, so long as one also cares for the self and its limits both physical and psychological, is associated with self-reported physical health. Lastly it compells oneself to take all the risks in the earth to make your love believe that he/she is are the best.

If the question is about the early stages of "romantic love" - usually just termed "love",(though there are many other kinds of love), it causes a psychotic state in which one obsesses about the object of one's affection as a result of dopamine/ phenylethyamine/ norepinephrine driven high and lowering of all ability for rational thought due to resultant lowered serotonin levels to focus on being able to bond rather than judge! Other kinds of love (and more latter developed stages of couple love) - don't really "change" the individual, though it may have an impact on their evolution as an individual while strengthening who they are by fulfilling the love and belonging (social needs) of an individual that is so essential to be able to achieve self esteem and thereafter possibly self actualization and transcendence. Refer revised/ enhanced version of Maslow's pyramid of needs:

Yes. But the other guy didn't believe so. I believe it now more than ever. He got afraid, decided to pull out for trivial reasons, feared getting a disease I have had since childhood, said our life preferences didn't match, maybe decided my character and virtues weren't helpful for his life and career (or whatever the reasons were), and tried to give me a smooth answer in order not to upset me (it worked the opposite). But he gave me the certainty that love can change me, a faith I now have, even if it would never happen again during my life. Even if he actually didn't believe in it himself, or only saw it too shortly and uncertainly, it doesn't matter, for he lit a light in me and now I know it. Do you think rain can make a plant grow? It will work and the rain doesn't have to know what it's doing.

Yes, if you Love Krishna / God then there can be change The basic principle of the living condition is that we have a general propensity to love someone. No one can live without loving someone else. This propensity is present in every living being. Even an animal like a tiger has this loving propensity at least in a dormant stage, and it is certainly present in the human beings. The missing point, however, is where to repose our love so that everyone can become happy. People become frustrated looking for the perfect object of love. We may love our brother and sister, our mother and father, our wife or husband, our friends, our community, our nation, the international community, or even all human beings, yet still our love will remain imperfect. That is because it is not all-inclusive. For example, every country considers the human beings residing there to be nationals, but not the animals. But "national" means anyone who takes birth in that country. In Sanskrit the word is prajä, "those who take birth." So it is the duty of the leader of a country to protect all prajä residing there. Not that only human beings should be protected, while the animals—the cows, pigs, chickens, and so on—are slaughtered. They are also prajä. When one becomes Krishna conscious, however, he loves every living being because of its connection with Krishna Ref:Quest for Enlightenment -source BBT

Forgive and forget is what I learnt from love.  I was an adamant girl, who will get aggression if something what I desire does not happen. I have hurt my parents and friends due to this nature.  But fortunately or unfortunately, love turned me into new person. My bf is more adamant than me, consoling or convincing him will be a difficult task for me to hold our relationship.  We used to fight for silly things, as we both are not ready for compramising. After some point of time,I realised that If both are adamant, our love will not last. So I took a decision to change my nature to him. I began to compramise even though,  he only committed the mistake. That made a huge change in my life. Gradually that became my nature and now am feeling happy that I'll not hurt anyone through my adamant nature.Thanks for the LOVE that changed me!!!!!! So please everyone have a true love in life to expect the unexpected change in you !!! :) Happy love days <3

3 years old : I love chocolates, I want all of them. I am not sharing with anyone. 8 years old : I love chocolates. My sister likes it too. I will give half of what I have to her and she will be happy. 18 years old : I love her. I want her. 23 years old : I love her. I want her to be happy. 26 years old : I love her. I want her to be happy. With me or with someone else that she loves. It is not about possessing her. And so on. Love matures with time. Love nurtures. Love isn’t just that physical attraction. It is that respect and care when everything else withers. Prasanna Venkatesh's answer to What is the most complicated romantic relationship you've had? Was there any relationship that changed your life?

When you find the one person who takes who you are to be the one who shares your heart you become different in that your wake and sleep is now part of who has your heart. The person you become may or may not be different, but what is a change is in the completion love has brought to you as being full. Because of love, at the meant to be time in the essence of that which you have always been, will be the joining of that someone who completes you. You will find your breath and thoughts are not your own, but shared as it is in this love you cannot live without. So yes, it is in the eyes of the one who loves you as forever unconditionally. Understand this different person is two hearts. One together.

People change for many reasons, but they don’t like to do it and it is very difficult to sustain a change unless you have a deep-rooted and compelling reason for doing so. People change when they believe a change will make them happier or more secure. Sometimes, being a better person in order to keep a partner content is enough- but they aren't changing for YOU. They are changing for themselves. Nothing you say, nothing you do and nothing you wish for is going to motivate another person to make long-term change if they do not internalize the need for it. Love someone where they are, not where you want them to be. If you aren't compatible, then make the hard choice to move on. Its a decision that shows respect for the other person’s autonomy, and it preserves your own dignity.

Love makes you want to upgrade in every sphere of your life. It makes you want to fly higher, dream bigger. To hope with all your heart, and to pray for someone other than your own self. It gives you an illusion of perfection, complete and flawless; an illusion so beautiful, you want to be capable of it. It helps you get rid of bad habits, though itself forms the most dangerous of all addictions. It teaches you where to draw lines between self esteem and unconditionality. It teaches you to walk away stronger, even with your heart trembling and craving to go back. And most importantly, it helps you grow into someone who has a capability of giving, appreciating and finding magic in a dark, dull, realistic, ordinary life. One love is all we need!

When we Fall in Love we are ready to do anything for our Love. We Work on ourselves so that we can Improve and Be a Better Version of Ourselves which “SHE” will Like. We never Leave any stone Untouched to Impress “HER’. We Try to eradicate the Bad Habits we have for “HER’. We Work Hard So that we can provide her Everything she Desires. Many-a-times we do things against our Wish just because she likes it and we want to see her Happy! We Happily Leave Our Happiness If That Makes ‘Her’ Happy :) So Yes Dear Reader, Love can change someone Completely!

Yeah, both in a good way and bad way. Depends upon the love experience a man goes through. But yeah its very powerful and can change anyone. My parents loves me a lot and as I am growing up, I am taking decisions in my life which would be in favor of their comfort and well being. I could spoil myself! I could go out and enjoy life like almost everyone I know are enjoying, But for now all that enjoyment wont let me become capable of giving everything back to my parents for all that they had done for me. Bad experience, well see all those depressed people around you ? Some had lost their friends, some had lost their partners because things didn't turn out as they expected.

Yes. It can turn your world upside down with more than the capacity you thought you could take. I realized that I am capable to have these one sided feelings so strong yet do hidden inside me that I can make myself believe that there none. Love can give you so many perspectives to look at a situation. It can change you completely. Some might be betrayed, felt played with or cheated with, some might think they have been galvanized, in a sense. Therefore, love is miraculous.

love can change anyone . Infact world can be changed if there is love . one of kabiradas dhoa says just if you know this love word you don't need to know anything else . The word love is so important reason being when we are in love we never see the negative points of others.we feel they are the best. no fighting ,no anger ,no agony.everything looks melody and person seems to be changed.

Can someone become a completely different person because of love? It certainly can! Love can increase your self esteem Love can make you more happy Love reduces your risk of depression Love is like Tylenol Love is a good drug Love is addictive Love makes you better And worse Love can make you possessive Love can crush you when it's over Love can give you Broken Heart Syndrome Love can cause depression Love is like a drug Love is addictive Love makes you worse But in the end, it all depends on how you choose to use it. -Risa

No. Loving someone is not enough for a change. For love one may try or make efforts to change but whether such efforts will succeed or not shall depend on the grit, persistence, dedication and tenacity of the person trying to change. Most of the time for love people do wish to change, however, very few are capable of converting wishes into reality. So don’t expect anyone to change. If someone is not good for you on as it is basis it is better to stay away than hoping for miraculous changes.

No. That person may be on their best behavior, but they are still limited to the best they can do. And they are limited further by their response when issues and difficulties come up, which they always do at some point in every relationship. Not to say everyone cannot improve themselves to become the best person they can be, because they can. But that requires a lot more than simply loving another person; it requires effort and work to learn and improve.

Love can change writers and poets. My friend is a poet who used to write beautiful poems mainly about pain and hardships in life. But after falling in love, she sent me a poem about new found sunshine and positivity in her life. Now, she might say that she is referring to the actual sunlight but I know who that sunshine is. She is falling in love and growing at the same time. Also, now I have to read a whole new genre of poems :)

Not at all.Even though you think you loved someone as much as you can or can give your life for him/her. it still not be sure that him/her will change their habits or bihaviors for you. because love is just “passion”, but not “enforcement”. So,you only inspired them to change, but not make them to change. remember that “You can’t change anyone except yourself.” then, don’t put expectation in love. because you will fail with it. just love in what you and his/her are being.because that is “the nature of love.”

Condition: I take it that this man needs love. Love by itself cannot change anyone into anything. That’s a complete and utter myth. THEY can change THEMSELVES. YOU cannot do it. But - if you can offer them the platform and the support that they need to change themselves from whoever they were into whoever they want to be, that - is unconditional love.

I was sick and wanted a nap, my adorable little one came to my bedside and softly rubbed her cheeks against mine,put her tiny hands on mine and said ‘mom , I am taking away the pain”, she sat on my bed disregarding her favourite show running , My heart expanded , so much that I felt it would burst, Love changes you inside out and head to toe. You will know how your heart can melt and get fully blown into a balloon without bursting out loud.  Representative image, Image from google search.

Yes, love can change someone completely BUT there is a catch It can be pure and true Or It can be possesive and maddness. Both results into complete transformation of the person But The only difference between them is one understands emotions, and values them While other becomes aggressive and looks for revenge. Peace.

Yeah people change when they love someone. When you're in love with someone you wanna be like how they love to see you . Yeah true love means we have to accept the person as they are . But sometimes we need to change according to the person we love the most. I was a dumbo but when I felt love I did a lot of things I thought I would never do . Sometimes love makes you a better person through little changes. So I think it's ok Little changes.

Love changes people if it is the right kind of love. It changes a person in a very slow and unique way if the two people are compatible and enhance each others happiness. Love is a growing emotion and when you encounter someone who uplifts you, believes in you, understands you, cares for you, and aims to be your better half-you will definitely look at the world differently. It's a very spiritual type love that not everyone gets to experience.

Obviously yes! People change in love,but only if the love is true by both sides. People smile more for no reasons,they give more time to themselves for how they look,and well many more things….. But to be changed is good,because a person can only change in better person than what he/she was love makes the boy and girl both day dreaming only\U0001f602

Yes I believe. It happen with me before 3 months ago. People can change in anyway . They want there comfort and satisfaction towards there mindset, feelings , and physically. Now a days we can't trust or even blame them. Because it is not in our hands…to make someone love us.

Yes 1.when we found Someone who really matter for us then we feel awesome or be always happy just because our love. 2.when we lost your love then we forget everything in our life and feeling alone like there is no body for us . So love change us in 2 ways When we found true love or when we lost our love.

Yes they do. Love makes you a better person, or Id rather say Love should make you a better person. However one must remember that being a better person and completely changing who you are for someone else isnt the same thing. So before you go ahead and change yourself, stop for a minute and wonder if you want to change a particular quality of yours or not? Accept your faults and work on them but dont loose yourself. Improve, dont change.

Yes it is powerful. It can lead to a whole lot of positive impact on a person or negative depending on the equation and person you are in love with. People change when they are in love. Positively or negatively depends on person to person.
Yes. But rarely it's true love that brings the change in a person. Most of the time it's the bad time, enmity, grudge, jealous, defeat, betrayal, etc. that actually changes a person.

Some people do change for their partner when they are in love. But many people won’t change and they perfectly pretend to have changed as per the wishes of their partner. The same thing can be revealed once they broke up their relationship. If they have changed permanently, they won’t attempt to harm or demoralize the others post breakup. As many people do these, we can say that they didn’t change.

sorry to be the bearer of bad news but people only change if they have the inner motivation for that. I.guess your question should read as to.whether the person would change for you? If you want to change someone when they don't want to, that's not love, it's violation of their free will.

Love is a feeling and as per philosophy there are 9 other feeling like sadness,,,anxious,,kindness,,,happiness….the human beings have changing nature as per their feelings..so bt obvious ppls may change in love and out of love also . the change is only constant for nature and as a natural being human also change as per their own feeling,,..

Love can only change someone if the person wants to change. If the person’s heart cannot be softened, change will never happen. There must be some humility and very little arrogance, otherwise they will take for granted the person who is loving them.

Love gives us a sense of belonging, love attaches us to another living soul, entire new families and locations are formed and a virety of characters that require further research. There's great joy in loving someone, and an even greater joy being loved. Joy changes the hearts of people for the good, love creates happiness and happiness is contagious.

Love is the only medicine which can move the mountains, what you can do is love the person as he/she is. Expectation kill the charm of it. Dont complain and do your duties, within a short span of time you will see the transformation.

yes, if they really love some one.Most of the time its just sex and need for sex. how they can get it. any mean possible so except to change till they are getting what they want . Love has different meaning for person to person. Conclusion only 1% of population will change other will never.

Yes. A true love is a true Bliss. Love keeps us enthusiastic and positive . Being loved by someone is a fortunate thing that happens in life. Similarly, it can be nightmare too. A failure in love will teach a lot. It's a phase where we need to get enough matured to deal with ourselves. In either ways, love predominantly plays over emotions .
If they truly love you then they can completely change. But if you love them, then you should not expect them to fall in love with you and completely change.

Yes definitely, the power of love can change a person's attitude, nasty behavior and bad habits. Perhaps not all but some are willing to go through great lengths to change or make certain sacrifice in their lives in the name of love.
I don't think it can....I know it.I actually had to grow up and be a man!

In many ways. But the end result will be two ways: If your partner and yourself are optimistic then you guys are gonna grow in life If either of u is pessimistic then you are doomed and it will be painful. This answer is if you both end up together or breakup.
Yes it does, eventually. But never mind if in between you loose your present embodiment; you (soul) are eternal to take another one and continue your mission forever.
